subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Ideogrammic compound: originally {{zh-l|*㝛}}. Represents the man ({{zh-l|*人}}) who brings under a roof ({{zh-l|*宀}}) smoked meat ({{zh-l|*肉}} abbreviated to {{zh-l|*㐁}}), to the traveller.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “To stay overnight; lodge > night; mansion of the zodiac [i.e. the Sun's lodging stations]”
: Probably related to Austroasiatic: cf. {{cog|mkh-okm||*ruk|to take cover or shelter}} > {{cog|km|ជ្រុក||shelter; refuge}}, {{cog|km|ស្រុក||settlement; village}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). {{zh-ref|Benedict (1972)}} relates it to the Tibeto-Burman terms listed in the etymology of {{och-l|夜|night}}, however the phonetics is difficult to reconcile in the current reconstructions.

subSections.text:

Compounds
subSections.text:
